medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 10 weeks before the presentation when back pain developed between the shoulder blades. This pain resolved over the next 2 weeks. Six weeks prior, numbness developed in a bandlike distribution around the trunk, extending to the upper abdomen five weeks prior. She experienced difficulty sitting up from a supine position, abdominal distention, and paresthesia in her fingers four weeks prior. Two weeks before this emergency presentation, numbness extended to the genital area and urinary incontinence developed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypothyroidism, symptomatic spinal stenosis (previously underwent L4â€“L5 decompression and bilateral medial facetectomy), open reduction and internal fixation of left tibial and fibular fractures, excision of a foreign body in the right thenar.
medical_history.social_history: Rare alcohol consumption, past tobacco use, no illicit drug use, married, lives with husband in a wooded area, works in health care.
